issue.title: USER-EES package
issue.body:
Source files, Documentations and some examples of "fix wall/ees" and "fix wall/region/ees" are added. 
These code is meant to calculate the interaction between ellipsoidal particles and a semi-finite wall introduced by Babadi and Ejtehadi.

issue.title: Library interface fixes, Python example fixes and better Python 3 compatibility
issue.body: This addresses issue #118 and fixes some bugs found in the library interface. Please not that some changes were necessary to make pizza.py Python 3 compatible.

issue.title: Added fix filter/corotate.

milestone.title: Stable release Spring 2017
milestone.description: This milestone should be used to tag all pending pull requests and issues that should be included into the next stable LAMMPS release in late march 2017

issue.body:
Hi there, 

this new fix extends the run_style respa. It implements a version of the mollified impulse method. The fix "mollifies" the outer stage of the impulse method/respa and can thus use larger time-step sizes. It is targeted for biomolecular simulations and a force-field with a separation in bond/pair and kspace. The "mollifier", or filter, uses pre/post-force routines on the outer stage. Based on corotational ideas this filter can extend the time-step of respa from around 4fs to over 8fs. This can be useful when the long-range electrostatic contributions are expensive to compute.

Two (small) examples are provided: the small peptide from the regular example section, and a short simulation of BPTI.

I hope other users will find this fix useful. 

Best, Lukas

issue.title: Correct a typo in the fix_halt.txt documentation.

milestone.title: Stable release Spring 2017
milestone.description: This milestone should be used to tag all pending pull requests and issues that should be included into the next stable LAMMPS release in late march 2017

issue.title: Removed triclinic restrictions on slab ewald/pppm.
issue.body:
Since the slab correction applies specifically to the z-direction, it is not influenced by tilt.  I have confirmed the correction by calculating it manually for a system with 2 charges (+1 at 0,0,1.5 and -1 at 0.0,-1.5).  The files are attached:

[ewtest.zip](https://github.com/lammps/lammps/files/835435/ewtest.zip)

Four cases are tested -- an orthogonal and a triclinic box with and without the slab correction.
Although changing the box tilt alters the energies and forces, the correction term is identical for both, as it should be.

issue.title: Removed triclinic restrictions on slab ewald/pppm.
issue.body:
Since the slab correction applies specifically to the z-direction, it is not influenced by tilt.  I have confirmed the correction by calculating it manually for a system with 2 charges (+1 at 0,0,1.5 and -1 at 0.0,-1.5).  The files are attached:

[ewtest.zip](https://github.com/lammps/lammps/files/835435/ewtest.zip)

Four cases are tested -- an orthogonal and a triclinic box with and without the slab correction.
Although changing the box tilt alters the energies and forces, the correction term is identical for both, as it should be.

issue.title: add new pair potential for metal-organic interactions - pair_zhou
issue.body:
Hi,

Our lab created a new potential for metal-organic interactions.
We have been using it in our lab for 2-3 years, so it has matured and we would like to contribute it to the main repository.

Description of the potential can be found in:
http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/jp412098n
Zhou, Ya, Wissam A. Saidi, and Kristen A. Fichthorn. "A force field for describing the polyvinylpyrrolidone-mediated solution-phase synthesis of shape-selective Ag nanoparticles." The Journal of Physical Chemistry C 118, no. 6 (2014): 3366-3374.

I wouldn't mind putting together a documentation for this potential.

Thanks!
Tonnam

issue.title: Added fix filter/corotate.

milestone.title: Stable release Spring 2017
milestone.description: This milestone should be used to tag all pending pull requests and issues that should be included into the next stable LAMMPS release in late march 2017

issue.body:
Hi there, 

this new fix extends the run_style respa. It implements a version of the mollified impulse method. The fix "mollifies" the outer stage of the impulse method/respa and can thus use larger time-step sizes. It is targeted for biomolecular simulations and a force-field with a separation in bond/pair and kspace. The "mollifier", or filter, uses pre/post-force routines on the outer stage. Based on corotational ideas this filter can extend the time-step of respa from around 4fs to over 8fs. This can be useful when the long-range electrostatic contributions are expensive to compute.

Two (small) examples are provided: the small peptide from the regular example section, and a short simulation of BPTI.

I hope other users will find this fix useful. 

Best, Lukas
